alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Middlesex; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 15 at 4:49PM EDT until April 15 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Mercer County in central New Jersey... Southern Somerset County in northern New Jersey... Southwestern Middlesex County in northern New Jersey... * Until 515 PM EDT. * At 449 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Princeton Meadows, or 12 miles southwest of New Brunswick, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. * Locations impacted include... New Brunswick, Somerset, East Brunswick, South Brunswick, North Brunswick, Princeton, Jamesburg, Hightstown, Cranbury, Rocky Hill, Princeton Meadows, Windsor, Kingston, Dayton, Plainsboro Center, Belle Mead, North Brunswick Township, Clearbrook Park, Edinburg and Twin Rivers. This includes New Jersey Turnpike between exits 8A and 10. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. In addition to large hail and damaging winds, frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
